intro: Hieracium glandulosissimum, commonly known as the glandular hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it its scientific name. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. Hieracium glandulosissimum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
